Rural Women Upliftment Association (RWUA), Haripur-02, Sarlaahi is a non-political, non-profit organization established 33 years ago on Kartik 22, 2050 B.S., with the vision of uplifting marginalized and rural women and communities. Since its inception, RWUA has been working in key areas including women‚Äôs empowerment, gender equality, social inclusion, education, health, livelihoods, child protection, Advocacy/lobbying, and transparent local governance, with a strong focus on Dalits, indigenous groups, persons with disabilities, and other marginalized populations. Through community-centred approaches, RWUA has supported capacity development, poverty reduction, counselling on foreign employment, assistance to vulnerable families, and overall empowerment.

RWUA, in partnership with Save the Children, has been funded, Implementing the Sponsorship (SAMUNNATI) Project in Sarlahi District since 2017 in Ishworpur and Haripur Municipalities, focusing on education, health, livelihoods, child protection, and advocacy, policy, and lobby, while continuing its recognised role as a leading gender / Child protection resource centre at district and regional levels.

RWUA now invites applications from interested and qualified Nepali citizens for the following position:

TITLE OF POSITION: Field Coordinator-Education

GRADE/LEVEL: Coordinator

LOCATION OF THE POSITION: RWUA Working Area ( Haripur 02 Sarlahi)

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR/REPORTING TO: Program Manager

POSITION TO BE SUPERVISED: Field Officer

WORKING AREA: Haripur and Ishworpur Municipality, Sarlahi

CHILD SAFEGUARDING:

The position holder will frequently have direct contact with children and/or young people in their day-to-day work. S/he will have to abide by the child safeguarding, protection from sexual exploitation, abuse, and harassment (PSEAH) policy, including the RWUA code of conduct. S/he will have to maintain dual adult rules while visiting/meeting with children.

ROLE PURPOSE:

The Field Coordinator ‚Äì Education is responsible for executing a range of activities within the education sector, focusing on Early Childhood Care and Development (ECCD) and Basic Education. The role encompasses strategic project planning, implementation, monitoring, reporting, and effective collaboration with local government (LG) counterparts and stakeholders to ensure project deliverables are met.

The incumbent supervises and mentors Field Officers, facilitates research, documents lessons learned, and promotes best practices. The position is accountable for managing field-level education activities, ensuring quality implementation, and preparing comprehensive reports. This role allocates approximately 70% of time to field-level operations and coordination and 30% to reporting and higher-level collaboration.

The Field Coordinator is also responsible for upholding organizational priorities, including safeguarding, zero-tolerance policies, and safety/security measures.

SCOPE OF ROLE:

Reports to: Program Manager

Staff reporting to this post: Field Officer

Budget Responsibility: Sponsorship Program

KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY:

Program Implementation:

  • Organize-workshops-trainings-meetings/discussions/interactions/review meetings/learning sharing events as per the implementation plan and timely communicate the roles and responsibilities of the other project staff.
  • Ensure that the information from the monitoring & Evaluation system is accessible and usable for program development by maintaining a proper filing (electronic, manual) system for programming.
  • Lead, manage, implement, and monitor programme activities effectively and regularly in coordination with the Education Development Coordination Unit, municipality, Consortium partners, and schools (including
  • ECCD, basic education, inclusive education, ReAL program, school leadership, and management approach activities).
  • Support to conduct activities for the capacity building of organizations of persons with disabilities (OPDs), the Disability Coordination Committee, and community groups so that they work for the people with disabilities, especially children, for their education through the School at Home approach.
  • Support to build the capacity of local government on policy/guideline formulation, development, budgeting, and planning processes on inclusive education.
  • Support that the project activities related to child protection, CP advocacy, GESI, and community-based awareness raising on inclusive education will be implemented, coordinating with and thematic staff.
  • Support to schools in developing/updating the School Improvement Plan (SIP) in a participatory way with the incorporation of inclusive and quality education, SHN, and safe and green schools.
  • As per the guideline developed for parents/caregivers of children with disabilities, engaged with them to understand and influence their positive attitudes fostering toward their children with disabilities.
  • Provide parental education, monitor learning environments at home, and offer solutions to improve the learning environment at home.
  • Encourage parents to enrol their children with disabilities in schools and advocate for education during home visits and enrolment campaigns.
  • Provide a special package of support to children with disability to continue education at home/school (e.g., assistive devices, IEP, need-based prototype inclusive learning materials)
  • Support schools to conduct inclusive ECA and sports activities that can be accessible for children with disabilities in collaboration with ECO clubs.

Budgeting and Planning

  • Lead the operational planning and budgeting for the education theme (Master Budget, Detail Implementation Plan & Indicator Progress Tracking Tools).
  • Contextualise activities and plans in consultation with the Program Manager and Finance Unit to ensure effective implementation.
  • Prepare project partnership agreements, operational guidelines, consultant terms of reference (TORs), and sustainability frameworks.
  • Support field officers in understanding activity budgets and managing expenditures.
  • Develop and implement monthly action plans and assist the Field Officer in doing the same.
  • Ensure timely procurement of materials and equipment for project activities.

Monitoring

  • Track and update thematic activity progress to ensure alignment with project objectives and timelines.
  • Monitor activities for cost-efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Collaborate with LGs to promote the sustainability and innovation of education-related interventions.
  • Conduct participatory reviews and learning-sharing meetings with LG counterparts.
  • Work closely with the Admin and Finance team to address audit compliance requirements.
  • Prepare monitoring reports after field visits and share findings with relevant stakeholders.
  • Assist in developing and implementing monitoring and evaluation tools to document project successes and challenges.

Reporting

  • Consolidate and prepare project reports (e.g., quarterly, semi-annual, annual, and event-specific reports).
  • Maintain up-to-date information and data on program activities and indicators on the Online Program Management Information System (OPMIS) and Total reach beneficiaries.
  • Provide technical input for LG periodic reports and analyses when required.
  • Submit individual monthly/quarterly work plans and progress reports to the Line Manager.
  • Document and share project learnings, success stories, and case studies on a quarterly basis.

Capacity Development

  • Facilitate training and workshops on education-related activities for teachers, headteachers, MSCs, PTAs, and LG representatives.
  • Enhance the capacity of field officers through targeted training programs.

Evidence Generation

  • Produce and disseminate IEC materials, policy briefs, factsheets, and learning materials on education and public learning quality.
  • Document innovative approaches and evidence of impact from thematic activities.

Safeguarding and Well-being

  • Ensure adherence to the organization‚Äôs safeguarding policy.
  • Report protection concerns to the programme manager.
  • Promote the well-being of team members, addressing challenges as needed.

Representation

  • Represent the organization in educational forums, meetings, workshops, training, and seminars as directed.

Others

  • Perform dual roles in development and humanitarian work during emergencies.
  • Undertake additional tasks as assigned by the Line manager under the sponsorship program portfolio.
  • Prepared the Samunnati Program report according to the donor-required basic
  • Prepared Quarterly/Semi-annual Report/Annual Report according to the Donor’s requirements
  • Prepared AGM Report/organisational occasional programme.
  • Own a two-wheeler and a Valid driving Licence

QUALIFICATION, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:

Education:

  • Master‚Äôs in education (M.Ed.) from a recognized institution with at least 3 years of relevant experience. or Prior experience in education implementation and sponsorship programs is preferred. Experience working in multicultural environments (3 Years Working Experience in a Coordinator Post)
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in education (B.Ed.) from a recognized institution with at least 5 years of relevant experience. or Prior experience in education implementation and sponsorship programs is preferred. Experience working in multicultural environments.

Skills:

  • Profound technical skills in writing, data analysis and knowledge on Excel and other tools.
  • Sound knowledge on human rights to education, child rights and issues of SDG4.
  • Good skills in networking, coordination, communication, management and advocacy.
  • Good Interpersonal Skills to deal with colleagues in the organization and capacity and willingness to work under pressure and multiple deadlines.
  • Project management, good communication skills with English and Nepali language competency both in speaking and writing.
  • Knowledge of Monitoring and Evaluation, research and documentation.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrated experience in developing inclusive education methodologies and tools.
  • Proven track record of working with all layers of government and CSOs.
  • Demonstrated experience in small grant handling, monitoring, and reporting.
  • Ability to design and implement training programs and curricula.
  • Knowledge of the SESP, ReAL Plan, and experience in its implementation is highly desirable.
  • Good experience in facilitating training for diverse target groups.
  • Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
  • Excellent computer skills (MS Word, WordPerfect, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Enthusiasm for working with diverse, multidisciplinary teams and rural communities.
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate with relevant stakeholders.

Position: People & Culture Trainee
Location: Kusunti, KC Tower, Lalitpur, Nepal

With 75 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children‚Äôs life stories!

Employee Contract Type:

Local – Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Job Description:

The main purpose of the P&C Trainee is to support the effective functioning of the People & Culture (HR) Department. The trainee will have the opportunity to learn from all aspects of the department, including systems administration, recruitment and personnel administration.

The traineeship provides an opportunity for a recent graduate to start their career in Human Resources (HR), working for an international NGO. They will have the opportunity to learn more about World Vision International Nepal and contribute to the organization‚Äôs strategic goal of working with the most vulnerable children and families.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Ensure the proper documentation of end to end employee cycle processes

  • Creation and maintenance of digital staff files employment paperwork
  • Maintain a proper filing system

Provide administrative support to ensure employee‚Äôs information (onboarding, exit docs) is in place

  • Prepare all the documents for New Starter Packs and ensure all documents are in place after onboarding of new staff
  • Prepare all documents for exiting staff, including administrative work (e.g. printing letters, certificates, etc.)
  • Ensure all documents are in place with 100% accuracy as per the checklist
  • Schedule the orientation for new staff and ensure new hires complete the orientation within 45 days of their joining date.

Support to deliver high quality end-to-end recruitment processes

  • Schedule and inform candidates for the written test and interviews
  • Support in conducting the written test
  • Conduct pre-employment checks, including references, Block Party Screening, Police clearance, and other qualification checks.
  • Provide timely communication to the candidates, such as information about the written test and Interviews

Team Support and Customer Service

  • Ensure the People & Culture Intranet site is up to date with appropriate information, forms, policies and other resources
  • Support in handling medical claims and ensure timely communication with the staff and the service provider related to the medical claims
  • Work with peers to manage workloads and support achievement of department objectives
  • Identify, build relationships and work with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure effective delivery of support services and information
  • Contact point for People & Culture general enquires, directed to appropriate team member for response
  • Take initiative and be proactive in identifying and resolving the needs of the People and Culture team
  • Contribute to People & Culture projects as agreed with supervisor
  • Ensure systematic P&C processes for efficient operations
  • Provide end user support for P&C Systems

Demonstrate personal and professional growth

  • Spend time learning specific skills and capabilities to enhance the capacity in different functions under People and Culture Department
  • Apply the learning within the work scope

KNOWLEDGE/QUALIFICATIONS/ EXPIRENCE FOR THE ROLE

Required Education

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business, Management, Human Resource Management or related field

Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of administration
  • Strong clerical, computing and organisational skills, in particular use of Microsoft Office Programs.
  • Knowledge of team administration and business processes
  • Proficient written and verbal communication skills in both English and Nepali including across cultures
  • Good systems ability
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness, adaptability, and flexibility
  • High attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability and commitment to listen to others

** IF YOU ARE FORMER REGISTERED CHILDREN OF WVIN PLEASE MENTION THIS IN YOUR CV/ APPLICATION LETTER

Position: Finance Officer
Location: NP-Kathmandu
Job ID: 2026-7516

MOMENTUM Country and Global Leadership (MCGL), funded by the U.S. Government, is a global mechanism that saves lives and improves access to quality, integrated health services by distributing life-saving commodities, medicines, and vaccines, and providing critical health care services for pregnant mothers and children under five. The project provides safe childbirth for mothers and babies, vaccinates children, treats deadly illnesses and malnutrition, and controls disease outbreaks.

The Finance Officer will contribute to the financial oversight of the MCGL project by tracking project expenditures, monitoring budget performance, and ensuring proper financial documentation is maintained. They will also assist in preparing timely financial reports for submission to Donor, Jhpiego headquarters, and other stakeholders. The Officer oversees the financial aspect of Jhpiego programs in Nepal and ensures that financial systems are sound and compatible with standard accounting practices and follow USG, MCGL, JHU and Jhpiego rules and regulation. This includes assisting day to day financial operations of Nepal Country Office. Implement and maintain an on-site financial accounting and bookkeeping system required to assure the integrity and effective performance of Jhpiego Nepal’s financial operations.

(The Position is open only for Jhpiego’s Internal Staffs.)

Responsibilities

Specific Responsibilities

  • Review and verify invoices for accuracy, completeness, and proper documentation, ensuring compliance with organizational and donor guidelines.
  • Ensure all expenditures are within the approved budget and have received the necessary authorization.
  • Process payment vouchers, checks, and electronic funds transfers (EFT) in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Monitor expenditures against approved budgets and work plans, providing regular updates.
  • Follow up on accounts receivable and ensure timely liquidation of staff advances.‚ÄØ.
  • Maintain organized physical and electronic filing systems for accounting records, ensuring easy access and retrieval of documents.
  • Assist in developing work plans and budgets, participating in ongoing budget tracking and adjustments.
  • Assist in conducting financial and compliance reviews for program activities, ensuring adherence to donor and internal regulations.
  • Ensure office financial operations with particular emphasis on implementing and maintaining on-site financial accounting and bookkeeping system.
  • Assists in monthly financial reporting –
  • Reports on obligations and expenditure of the program budgets, including sub-agreement budgets with partner and donor agencies.
  • Maintain and file vouchers, petty cash, payments, and other financial communication and documentation.
  • Coordinate with Province Team esp Admin & Finance Asst/ Provincial Specialist for collecting/recording expenditure on district-based activities and travel expenses.
  • Assist and support & Guide Province- Admin finance team in program activities related to finance (workshop/training) in Centre and in Province
  • Support internal audits, donor reviews, and external audits as required.
  • Prepare and submit VAT reporting to USG, ensuring accurate and timely reconciliation of VAT claims as per donor requirements.
  • Perform any additional duties as assigned by the supervisor to support financial and administrative operations.

Required Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting or Finance or related subject.
  • At least 5 to 6 years of directly relevant experience required
  • Demonstrated proficiency in MS office/ Excel in presenting, analyzing and interpreting data.
  • Understanding of Government of Nepal rules, regulations and policies in accounting and finance; and familiarity with I/NGO and donor-supported projects.
  • Excellent communication skills including fluency in spoken and written English
  • Ability to handle a variety of assignments under pressure of deadlines; must be cooperative, hardworking, flexible and dependable.
  • Willingness to travel locally.

Experience and Skills

  • Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks), MS Office, and Excel.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills.
  • Strong verbal and written communication abilities.
  • Jhpiego offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive employee benefits package.

Please apply at www.jhpiego.org/careers

Applicants must submit a single document for upload, including a cover letter, resume, and references.

For further information about Jhpiego, visit our website at www.jhpiego.org

Note: The successful candidate selected for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation.

Jhpiego is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to tough international child safeguarding standards.

Jhpiego, a Johns Hopkins University affiliate, is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of gender, marital status, pregnancy, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, other legally protected characteristics or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. Jhpiego promotes Affirmative Action for minorities, women, individuals who are disabled, and veterans.

RECRUITMENT SCAMS & FRAUD WARNING

Jhpiego has become aware of scams involving false job offers. Please be advised:

  • Recruiters will never ask for a fee during any stage of the recruitment process.
  • All active jobs are advertised directly on our careers page.
  • Official Jhpiego emails will always arrive from a @Jhpiego.org email address.

Please report any suspicious communications to Info@jhpiego.org

Mount Everest Forest Botanicals Alliance (MEFBA), through private sector investment, is implementing the TerraMrida Landscape Restoration Project – a community-led shade-grown coffee cultivation initiative focused on agroforestry, nursery development, and nature-based climate solutions in eastern Nepal. The project operates in coordination with Diktel-Rupakot-Majhuwagadhi Municipality for local facilitation.

MEFBA invites applications from motivated fresh agriculture graduates for immediate field placement to support on-ground implementation and GIS-based documentation.

Position: Project Field Assistant ‚Äì Agriculture & GIS

Assignment Duration

  • 4 months (Short-term)
  • Immediate mobilization required

Duty Station: Diktel, Khotang District (Field-based with regular travel to project sites)

Key Responsibilities

  • Support field implementation of coffee agroforestry and landscape restoration activities
  • Conduct GIS-based mapping, GPS data collection, and plot boundary demarcation
  • Assist in baseline surveys, geo-referenced photo documentation, and farmer data collection
  • Support community nursery management and basic nursery records
  • Maintain field documentation, activity logs, and progress reports
  • Data entry, analysis, and reporting using MS Excel and MS Office
  • Coordinate with local farmers, communities, and field supervisors

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Fresh graduate in Agriculture, Forestry, Natural Resources, or related discipline
  • Independent GIS expertise (QGIS/ArcGIS, GPS handling)
  • Strong proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel
  • Exposure to nursery management or plantation work (preferred)
  • Ability to work in remote rural field conditions
  • Must own a motorbike with valid driving license
  • Strong documentation and reporting skills

Compensation & Facilities

  • Salary: NPR 30,000 per month
  • Free food and boarding at MEFBA project field hostel, Diktel

Career Opportunity

High-performing candidates will be considered for permanent placement with MEFBA after completion of the assignment, with a commensurate salary.

Application & Selection

This is an urgent field requirement. Preference will be given to candidates who can mobilize immediately.

Interested candidates must submit the following to info@forestalliancenepal.com within 31st January, 2026:

1. Updated CV with Facebook Profile link
2. Recent passport-size photograph
3. Structured self-assessment of GIS and field competencies (covering GPS data collection, shapefile creation, KML/KMZ, Excel-based reporting, and field documentation)
4. Scenario-based written response (maximum 1 page) as outlined below
5. (Optional but strongly preferred) Sample GIS or Excel work demonstrating relevant skills

Scenario-Based GIS & Field Documentation Task

(To be submitted as part of the application ‚Äì max 1 page)

Imagine a coffee-based agroforestry project implemented at a landscape scale. The project consists of a cluster of 50 independent cooperative societies, collectively forming the overall project area. The aggregate farmland of all member farmers constitutes the effective project boundary.

Each cooperative society comprises 25‚Äì40 member farmers. Individual farmers cultivate shade-grown coffee under agroforestry systems, with one or more farm plots per farmer.

For project documentation, monitoring, and reporting purposes, the spatial structure of the project is organized hierarchically as follows:

  • Individual farmer-owned farm plot polygons
  • Nested within a Cooperative Society polygon
  • Each Cooperative Society polygon further nested within the overall project boundary polygon representing all 90 cooperatives

Based on this structure, explain step-by-step how you would:

  • Collect and validate GPS data for individual farmer farm plots
  • Digitize farm-level polygon shapefiles
  • Delineate and verify Cooperative Society boundary polygons
  • Ensure correct spatial nesting and topology across all levels
  • Link spatial data with farmer and cooperative attributes in Excel
  • Export and share spatial outputs (shapefiles, KML/KMZ, maps) for reporting and field verification

Briefly mention the GIS tools/software you would use and how you would ensure data accuracy and consistency in a field-based setting.

Applications should be submitted promptly due to immediate mobilization requirements.

title.rendered: Programme Associate, Project Leader, GIS Expert,  Local Facilitators, Rapporteur, Field Mappers, Software Developers

content.rendered:
Being established in 1990, Nepal Federation of Indigenous Nationalities (NEFIN) is the one and only umbrella federation of Organizations of enlisted Indigenous Peoples of Nepal; a legally recognized organization registered under ‚ÄúOrganizations Registration Act, 2034‚Äù of Nepal.

NEFIN truly represents Nepal‚Äôs indigenous peoples who constitute 35% of total country population (Census 2021). From the day one of its establishment, NEFIN has been working for the protection of rights of Nepal‚Äôs indigenous peoples over their ancestral domain, traditional lands, territories and natural resources as well as their cultural heritages, history, language, scripts, culture, traditions and identity. It has played a historical role in establishment of federalism, secularism and proportionate representation in Nepal.

In collaboration with its international collaborators, NEFIN is planning to initiate interventions on mapping of ancestral domains, traditional lands, territories and natural resources under the communal use of indigenous peoples of Baglung, Okhaldhunga (Rolpa, Solukhumbu and Dhankuta) districts of Nepal.

Now, NEFIN is seeking to recruit qualified personnels for the positions detailed below:

Position: Project Leader
Required No.: 1

Requirements:

  • ¬†Post-graduate degree in development and social studies, NRM, law or management
  • ¬†At least 10 years of work experience in implementation of IPs rights related projects.
  • ¬†Fluent in English writing and speaking as well as in Nepali; knowlede of Magar, Sherpa and Tamang IPs would be added benefit.
  • Proven skills and experience in report writing, documentation and MS Office.

Position: GIS Expert
Required No.: 2

Requirements:

  • ¬†Post-graduate degree in GIS, geography, statistics, NRM or environment science
  • At least 10 years of work experience relevant field.
  • ¬†Proven skills and experience in GIS and Cartography.

Position: Rapporteur

Required No.: 1

Requirements:

  • ¬†Post-graduate degree in development and social studies, NRM, law or management
  • ¬†At least 10 years of work experience in implementation of development projects.
  • Fluent in English writing and speaking as well as in Nepali; knowledge of Magar, Sherpa and Tamang IPs would be added benefit.
  • Proven skills and experience in report writing, documentation and MS Office.

Position: Finance Officer
Required No.: 1

Requirements:

Community Family Welfare Association (CFWA) is a not for profit-making national NGO working since 1996. It is dedicated to work strategically to contribute to the overall development of disadvantaged groups with special focus on Children, young women, and another marginalized and disadvantaged groups. CFWA with the partnership of Plan International Nepal is going to implement ‚ÄúGirls Standing Strong (GSS) and Sponsorship (SC)” projects in Dhanusha District. CFWA hereby invites applications from suitable and qualified Nepalese citizens for the following positions:

Position: Project Coordinator

No. of Vacancy: 1

Project Coordinator leads the overall management of Plan International Nepal supported GSS/SC projects in the district under the guidance of the Executive Director/Chairperson and in coordination with Project Specialist- Plan International Nepal. This position is responsible to provide overall programmatic and financial management support in planning, implementing, and monitoring activities of his/her district under the guidance of the Executive Director/Chairperson and in coordination with the Project Specialist.

Qualification: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Social Sciences, Development Studies, Management, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred), Minimum of 3‚Äì5 years of relevant experience in project coordination or management, preferably with NGOs/INGOs, Proven experience in donor-funded project implementation and reporting.

Duty Station: District Headquarters with 60% field visit

JD Link: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=11nKHHI3xfgjZnXYKk9fXxBow96Jfovgu

Qualified Nepali citizens meeting the above criteria are requested to send his/her updated CV and application to vacancy@cfwa.org.np by 21 January 2026 before 5.00 pm. Please specify the position title in the subject line for clarity in an application.

Age Limit: Candidates between 18 years to 50 years are only eligible to apply for the above position, depending upon the nature of job they will carry. Applications from marginalized, disadvantaged communities and local residents are encouraged to apply, and only shortlisted candidates will be invited for further process.

Job Title: Admin and Finance Officer

Duty Station: DBI Office, Kathmandu

Reports To: Program Director

Staff Reporting: Administrative Assistant, Office Assistant

Background:

Digo Bikas Institute (DBI) is a research and advocacy organization committed to promote ecological sustainability and social equity at policy and community level. Based in Kathmandu, DBI believes that Nepal (and the rest of the world) can develop meaningfully by identifying and applying alternative ways of meeting human needs without harming the nature and fellow human beings.

Vision
Digo Bikas Institute envisions an ecologically sound, socially just and prosperous society, and that it will continue to be so for future generations.

Mission
Digo Bikas Institute‚Äôs mission is to undertake research and action to stimulate informed discussion and strategic thought to advance alternative and local solutions to global problems.

Job Purpose:

This position will be overall responsible to perform the overall financial related tasks and provide support and supervision to administrative and human resources functions in the DBI Office and support area to ensure that the timely information and updates are available as required by Senior Management Team in Kathmandu and other funding partners.

Key Responsibilities:

Responsibility Area 1: Finance:

  • Oversee the financial operations of Kathmandu Office and support areas to ensure timely and accurate financial reports and practices including fund management, payroll, financial disbursements, ledgers etc.
  • Preparing the vouchers of all the transactions and entering them into FAMAS Accounting Package in the concerned books of account.
  • Collect and produce period reports from all support areas and timely submission of monthly report along with the fund request of all projects to Senior Management Team and concerned funding parters complying with prevailing rules and regulation of Government, policies of the organization as well as funding partners.
  • Verify and review of financial data, supporting documents, accounting and financial reports of the each projects and recommend and implement measure to ensure that financial reports are being generated accurately and timely for the purpose of reporting different stakeholders.
  • Coordinate with the organization‚Äôs internal auditor, statutory auditor and donor auditors to conduct organization audit and project audit.
  • Discuss of the findings of audit with Finance Head and Management Head in advance of finalizing audit report and incorporate audit comments.
  • Release monthly/quarterly budget to all districts as per approved DIP.
  • Analysis of expenses and payment to suppliers, Insurance Companies etc.
  • Timely deposit of TDS, PF and CIT.
  • Verify and review the transaction vouchers and supporting documents of support areas.
  • Preparation of Monthly Bank Reconciliation Statement.

Responsibility Area 2: Human Resource, Administration & Logistics (Supervisory Role)

  • Ensure that the office equipments and other institutional properties are well functioning and are safeguarded at all times.
  • Ensure the personal files are updated with all the required documents.
  • Ensure timely submission of the following reports to Senior Management Team, Funding Partners, and Support Areas
  • Attendance record of all the staffs along with the leave records and other substantiating documents.
  • Staff related document to update the personal files including the monthly time sheets.
  • Ensure that vehicles logbooks are kept accurately and up to date.
  • Ensure that the organizational properties are solely used for official purposes with proper documentation.

Responsibility Area 3: Procurement and Store Management

  • Assist Admin Officer in procurement process (procure required goods/materials as per organization and funding partner‚Äôs procurement policies, procedures and standard. of the organization ensuring their quality and cost effectiveness) and ensure the proper documentation of the procurement process.
  • Ensure safeguarding of assets and verify that assets are in existence and being used properly.
  • Ensure that logistic, procurement and store management has been done effectively following the organizational policy.

Responsibility Area 4: Program Implementation

  • Develop project budget in consultation with program team and management as per requirement.
  • Support in all support areas to ensure the project implementation based on the budget plan and update its expenses periodically to the Senior Management Team/Project Coordinators.
  • Ensure activities and expenditures claimed by field staffs are actual and eligible as per project documents.
  • Support program team for effective, efficiency and economically budget utilization to demonstrate the result of the concerned project.

Responsibility Area 5: Monitoring, documentation, and reporting

  • Regularly monitor and review the field activities in each support area to ensure that activities are in line with achieving expected outputs and booked expenses complying all requirements and policy.
  • Monitor ongoing levels of expenditure on individual project outputs as budgeted and provide timely advice of likely over and under spending budget.
  • Ensure systematic documentation to prepare and submit periodic (monthly, quarterly, semi-annual and annual) financial, management and progress reports to concerned line managers as per requirements.
  • Share promptly if found irregularity, laps, fraud, and deviation with evidence after analyzing the finance documents.

Responsibility Area 6: Other Tasks

  • Other responsibilities as assigned by Line Manager and Reporting Manager.

Qualifications and Key Competencies:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration/Business Studies with at least 2 year experience in Finance and Administration in I/NGOs.
  • Good understanding of current accounting standards, control issues/procedures, government laws and regulations and financial system of INGO/NGO.
  • Good communication, problem solving and teambuilding skills
  • Knowledge of purchasing, store management, logistic and administrative works
  • Capable of handling all types of financial logistic and administrative works. .
  • Computer skills including use of spreadsheet and electronic mail.
  • Knowledge of FAMAS (Accounting Software) will be an advantage.
  • Willingness and commitment to stay and work in remote areas of the support areas.

Interested candidates are requested to submit their application along with expected salary to hr@digobikas.org with the Title ‚ÄúAdmin and Finance Officer 2026‚Äù along with the following documents by 12th January 2026, before 5:00 PM NST.

DOCUMENTS TO BE SUBMITTED

  • Cover letter
  • CV

Only short-listed candidates will receive information for further selection process. An attempt to influence at any stage of the selection process will negate the cause of the candidate. DBI reserves the right to accept or reject all or any of the application.

KIRDARC is an NGO dedicated to uphold the rights of marginalized and excluded communities through its interventions on Human Rights, Democracy and Good Governance with especial focus on building capacities of right holders, duty bearers and civil society contributing to inclusive growth and fair development. It works with a vision of ‚Äòa just and prosperous society‚Äô.

KIRDARC Nepal is implementing the ‚ÄúIntegrated Protection and Community Engagement‚Äù and ‚ÄúIntegrated Nutrition and Livelihoods‚Äù Program in Jumla district in partnership with World Vision International Nepal. Therefore, KIRDARC Nepal is expecting the job applications from suitable qualified, dynamic, and motivated candidates to fulfill the vacant position of Protection Officer based in, Jumla district.

Position Description: Protection Officer, 1 Person (Based in district headquarter, Jumla)

Academic Qualification and Experience: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in social work, sociology, law, or a related field, with at least three years of relevant experience.

Key Skills and Knowledge required:- Strong understanding of child protection, survivor-centered approaches, and CP-related laws, policies, and mechanisms, with demonstrated experience in capacity building for children, parents, and caregivers, community campaigning, CP case management, and policy advocacy.

For more details, visit the detailed Job Description here.

Interested candidates who meet these criteria should send their Application Letter and KIRDARC Job Application Form to vacancy@kirdarc.org by 14 January 2026, before 5:00 PM. The CV/Resume is not necessary to submit but the prescribed KIRDARC Job Application Form is mandatorily required to apply. The interested candidates can download the KIRDARC Job Application form from here.

Preference will be given to disadvantaged groups (Female, Dalit, Janajati) and local resident in the recruitment process. The person working with this organization must be committed to following the provisions of the child protection and safeguarding policy of the organization. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Any telephone inquiries/and or attempts to apply undue influence will result in the disqualification of candidates. KIRDARC Nepal reserves the right to reject any application without assigning any reason whatsoever.

Note: The written test will be conducted physically at different cluster offices of KIRDARC Nepal. Candidates will be informed about the available locations and may select the one that is most convenient for them.

The Community Development Centre (CDC), established in B.S. 2049 by a group of dedicated development professionals and activists, is a well-recognized non-governmental organization with more than three decades of experience in community empowerment. With strong technical expertise, robust financial systems, and deep understanding of the local context, CDC has successfully led inclusive and multi-sectoral programs in Sudurpaschim Province. Its work spans across inclusive education, health, WASH, disaster risk reduction, youth engagement, child protection, and women‚Äôs empowerment. By addressing pressing challenges such as inadequate infrastructure, harmful social practices, governance gaps, low educational performance, and persistent barriers for marginalized groups, the organization has played a pivotal role in driving sustainable improvements in the lives of vulnerable communities.

CDC (Community Development Center) is implementing HATEMALO for Child wellbeing and Integrated Development Project in partnership with World Vision International Nepal (WVIN). The project is on implementation in Aadarsh RM, Sayal RM, DSMP municipality and Purbichauki RM of Doti District. Hence, CDC is is seeking qualified, dynamic and motivated Nepali citizens for Monitoring Evaluation Accountability and Learning (MEAL) Officer for the smooth implementation of the MEAL related activities.

¬†Position: MEAL Officer

Based: CDC Officer, Silgahdi, Doti

¬†Job purpose:

Under the overall guidance of the Program Manager/Program Coordinator, this position will be responsible for providing technical support to the program team in recording, compiling, verifying, analyzing, and updating program data. The role supports the program in conducting quality monitoring visits, overseeing the complaints and feedback mechanism, and providing regular, data-driven feedback to the program team to inform evidence-based decision-making. In addition, the position will support WVI Nepal in carrying out periodic baseline studies, evaluations, and outcome monitoring in the assigned program areas, while strengthening program quality and information management through improved monitoring and accountability systems.

Major Responsibilities

MONITORING:

  • Support to update beneficiaries’ information regularly in commcare system (developed by WVIN) to track all project beneficiaries
  • Monitor project activities, and produce and submit monthly report
  • Carry out quality outcome and quality monitoring and submit reports
  • Facilitate corrective actions based on the monitoring findings and update in the system
  • Maintain project database including relevant documents and reports
  • Compile, analyzes and present the key findings of monitoring in regular meetings
  • Provide necessary guidance to volunteers/enumerators for accurate data collection
  • Follow up project teams to implement recommendations and follow up actions provided after the monitoring

EVALUATIONS & LEARNING:

  • Collect and collate secondary data from various sources in working districts and municipalities for the purpose of assessments, baseline survey and evaluations- as per requirement of WVIN.
  • Take lead role for coordination, communication and getting necessary approval from local government authorities regarding baseline surveys, evaluations and special researches/studies
  • Provide necessary field support including communication to the respondents, arranging meetings, interviews and focus groups discussions for monitoring visits and evaluations/ field studies
  • Provide necessary information to project team during the time of DPAC /LPAC (district project advisory committee) meeting.
  • Support project teams to draw key learning, good practices and significant case stories from and share with senior management of organization as well as WVIN.

ACCOUNTABILITY

  • Facilitate beneficiary selection criteria including Most Vulnerable Children and Adult
  • Establish and operate information provision system on key aspects of the project (such as sharing key message on Technical Program to communities and stakeholders, message on community feedback and response mechanism, beneficiary selection process and criteria etc)
  • Establish and operate community feedback mechanism ensuring response and appropriate actions on the feedback and complaints raised from community that are under the responsibilities of PNGO as per prescribed feedback handling guidelines
  • Refer all feedback and complaints to WVIN on timely basis to make response and take action if they are directly associated with WVIN, its staff and operation.
  • Provide monthly report on accountability including feedback and response status to Field MEAL Specialist using prescribed format of WVIN

General

  • Carry out additional responsibilities as assigned by supervisor, including administrative and planning functions
  • Comply with WVIN‚Äôs child protection policies and practice with respect to child safeguarding, anti-fraud policy and other relevant policies and procedures.

Competencies:

Academic Qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in social science or development studies in the field relevant to M&E. At least 3 years of experience working with I/NGO in the field of monitoring, evaluation and accountability sector

Sector Knowledge, Skills & competency:

  • Data collection methodologies ‚Äì qualitative and quantitative
  • Effective written and oral communications skills including presentation and reporting skills
  • Computer and Technology literacy; Good computer skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint,

Ability to work under pressure

  • Develop tools to collect the information against indicator
  • Demonstrate collaboration & team building skills
  • Confidence to represent in district; government and other like-minded organization
  • Programme logic, indicators, M&E plan
  • Ability & Behaviors (Values in practice)
  • Achieving quality results and service
  • Communicating information effectively
  • Building collaborative relationships
  • Practicing gender and cultural diversity
  • Practicing accountability and integrity

Child and adult safe guarding and sponsorship business

  • Manage all the working environment in the office and working areas are child and adult sensitive
  • Guide the team and organization in managing protection related matters appropriately
  • Support the organization in complying with all child and adult safe guarding policies, requirements and audits
  • Manage all the sponsorship businesses as per the protocols and guidance provided by WVIN
  • Registered children participation are well reflected in the provided reporting platforms
  • Ensure operationalization of World Vision‚Äôs Child Sponsorship standards, Development Project Standards and sponsorship integration in all phases of programming

Languages: Proficient in Nepali and English, (both written and spoken)

Qualified and interested candidates are requested to apply with a cover letter and updated resume to email address cdc.vacancy@gmail.com by 11th January 2026 with in office time (17:00 PM).

Women, Dalit, Janjati, Madheshi and Muslim will be prioritized.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Telephone enquiries will not be entertained.

Recruitment Committee

CDC, Doti

title.rendered: Field Officer, Community Mobilizers cum JTA, Office Support Staff

content.rendered:
Forum for Rural Welfare and Agricultural Reform for Development (FORWARD Nepal) is a national nongovernmental organization working in the areas of livelihood enhancement, migration, psychosocial wellbeing, climate resilience, and community empowerment. With financial support from AWO International under the BMZ‚ÄìSocial Structure Fund, FORWARD Nepal is implementing the project ‚ÄúEmpowering Migrants for Sustainable Economic Development (MEED)‚Äù in Ichchhakamana Rural Municipality, Chitwan District.

The project works closely with potential migrants, returnees, migrants‚Äô families, youth, women, and marginalized communities by organizing them into community self-help groups, youth clubs, and networks, and supporting them through agriculture-based livelihood promotion, vocational skills, enterprise development, market linkage, and psychosocial support. FORWARD Nepal invites applications from qualified Nepalese citizens for the Ichchhakamana RM based following positions (requiring extensive field visits) with the reporting line to the Project Manager/Coordinator for the full time, fixed term contract (January 2026-December 2028).

Position: Field Officer – Institutional Dev. & Networking
Number: One
Position based: Ichchhakamana RM, Chitwan

Key Responsibilities

  • Support capacity strengthening of social structures at community, local, and district level institutions such as spouse groups, migrant networks, cooperatives, etc. engaged in safe migration, reintegration, and migration governance.
  • Facilitate and strengthen migration-related networks at local, and district levels. This includes mentoring and facilitating institutional development through support in the formulation of policies and guidelines, developing templates and providing documentation assistance.
  • Support institutionalization and functional linkage of Migration Information Centres (MICs) within local government systems and relevant provincial structures.
  • Organize and facilitate coordination meetings, consultative forums, policy dialogues, consultations and workshops.
  • Support evidence-based advocacy and policy lobbying on safe migration, migration governance, reintegration, and social protection.
  • Support dissemination of advocacy messages through networks, media, and public platforms.
  • Document good practices, lessons learned, and innovative approaches related to institutional development and networking.
  • Facilitate learning, exchange, and reflection events among partners, networks, and government stakeholders.
  • Provide technical backstopping to implementing partners on institutional strengthening and networking components.
  • Coordinate closely with other technical staff, M&E personnel, and Social Mobilizer JTAs to ensure integration across project components.
  • Contribute to activity planning, progress reporting, and documentation as per FORWARD Nepal and donor requirements.

Required Qualification, Experience, and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, Development Studies, Governance, Sociology, or a related discipline, with a minimum of five (3) years’ experience in institutional development, governance, networking, coordination, or advocacy-related roles, preferably in migration, labour, or social protection sectors;
  • Demonstrated experience working with civil society organizations, and networks; proven ability to facilitate multi-stakeholder coordination and policy dialogue;
  • Strong analytical, facilitation, and report-writing skills in Nepali and English;
  • Capacity to prepare policy-oriented documents and technical reports;
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills; and
  • Willingness to work extensively in rural and community settings.

Position: Community Mobilizers cum JTA (Seven – 1 per Ward)
Number: Seven (1 ward each)
Position based: Ichchhakamana RM, Chitwan

Key Responsibilities

  • Facilitate the formation and/or strengthening of Community Self-Help Groups (CSHGs) (approximately 10 per ward) with an inclusive composition (sex, ethnicity, etc.).
  • Support the formation and strengthening of Youth Clubs (one in each ward) to operate as ward-level migration and livelihood resource hubs.
  • Facilitate sessions for social structures (CSHGs, youth clubs, networks) on topics including group management, record keeping, leadership development, and democratic system development
  • Mobilize CSHGs and Youth Clubs for regular meetings and ensure the effective implementation of project interventions
  • Provide technical trainings and demonstrations on diversified livelihood options, including Vegetable and Fruit farming; oat farming, Pig farming, and Fisheries; Bee-keeping and post-harvest handling; etc.
  • Promote environment-friendly and sustainable agricultural practices among farmers and nature-based farming systems.
  • Disseminate appropriate technologies through demonstrations, in-site coaching, and conducting various technical sessions to enhance community awareness and skills.
  • Support trained youth in enterprise development and market linkage initiatives for consistent and better income, focusing on market-driven local job creation.
  • Facilitate regular sessions for social structures on issues of safer migration, anti-human trafficking, pre-requisites for migration, and available government services and entitlements.
  • Assist in linking targeted communities with relevant stakeholders and governmental social security services (health services, subsidies, Social Security Fund (SSF), etc.).
  • Support the project team in micro-level advocacy efforts with the local government for policy development/review related to youth engagement, utilization of fallow land, and job creation.
  • Collect field data, document case studies, capture good practices, and ensure timely and accurate tracking of project activities at the field level.
  • Prepare and submit quality weekly/monthly field activity reports to the Project Officers/Coordinator.

Required Qualification, Experience, and Skills

  • Junior Agriculture Technician from recognize institution, with the ability to provide practical, farmer-friendly technical training and guidance. Project will hire both the Technicians holding academic degree in Plant Science and Animal Sciences.
  • Trainings on Strong community mobilization and facilitation skills, nature-based/organic and climate resilient farming practices, will be an additional asset.
  • Experience of working with the similar technical role in hill and mountainous regions of the country.
  • Good documentation and reporting abilities.
  • Willingness to travel extensively, resides and work in remote rural settings.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
  • Good command of Nepali language; knowledge of local languages is an asset.



Salary and Benefits

Salary and benefits for above mentioned position will be as per project provisions and FORWARD Nepal HR policy.

Application Procedure

Interested candidates who meet these criteria can submit their application with the latest updated CV, a cover letter, and contact details of two professional references via the link https://forms.gle/x8hQT1FKAnT4pcrAA till January 11, 2026. Please visit https://www.forwardnepal.org/announcements for further information.

FORWARD Nepal is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages applications from disadvantage groups (Women, Dalit, Janajati, People Living with Disability) and local residents during recruitment process.

The Staff Hiring Committee of FORWARD Nepal reserves all rights to make the final decision. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a written examination. Telephonic enquiries shall not be entertained and any effort to influence to do so will result in disqualification. FORWARD Nepal reserves the right to reject and cancel this vacancy and application without assigning any reason whatsoever.

Interested candidates meeting the above criteria are requested to submit:

  • Updated Curriculum Vitae (CV)
  • Cover letter clearly indicating suitability for the position
  • Contact details of at least two professional referees
  • Applications should be submitted by the deadline mentioned above.

Staff Hiring Committee

FORWARD Nepal

Established in 2007 (2064 BS), Women for Women Forum Nepal (WOFOWON) is a non-profit Organization dedicated to ensuring the human and labor rights of women workers in the Entertainment and hospitality sectors (Dohori, Dance Bars, Spa/Massage centers, Cabin Restaurants, Eateries, etc.). As the first organization in Nepal established by and for women Workers in this sector, WOFOWON operates from a feminist perspective to empower workers, amplify their collective voice, and develop a feminist labor movement.

To strengthen our activities and advance the feminist movement by addressing labor issues, we are seeking a dedicated and experienced professional for the following position:

Position: Admin and Finance Officer

Number of Vacancies: 1 (One)

Location: Kathmandu with frequent visits to program areas.

Required Qualifications

Required Qualifications and Experience:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting or Management with 2-3 years of relevant work experience, OR a Master‚Äôs degree with 2 years of experience in the same field.
  • ¬†Excellent knowledge of tax regulations, financial compliance, and local laws in Nepal.
  • Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Tally, FAMAS) and advanced skills in MS Excel.
  • Strong communication and reporting skills in both Nepali and English.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Financial Management: Prepare annual, quarterly, and monthly budgets, forecasts, and financial reports ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  • Compliance: Ensure adherence to donor guidelines, organizational policies, and government tax regulations.
  • Cash & Bank Management: Regularly manage and reconcile petty cash, bank accounts, and financial transactions.
  • Audit Support: Assist in internal/external audits and implement corrective actions for any identified discrepancies.
  • Administrative Tasks: Maintain detailed records of staff contracts, personal files, and leave records; oversee office utilities, supplies, and procurement.
  • Asset Management: Ensure systematic inventory and asset management, including periodic verification of organizational property.
  • Logistics: Provide administrative support for workshops, seminars, and travel arrangements. Prepare annual, quarterly, and monthly budgets, forecasts, and financial reports, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

Skills and Competencies:

  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
  • Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail and multitasking ability.
  • Gender sensitivity and a commitment to social justice and inclusivity.

Application Process:

WOFOWON is committed to the rights of marginalized women and the LGBTIQ+ community (specifically trans-women workers). We strongly encourage women and those who identify as women to apply. Priority will be given to candidates from Dalit, Janajati, and other marginalized communities.

Documents to be submitted:

An updated Curriculum Vitae (CV).
A Cover Letter (detailing your experience and motivation for the role).
Email to: wofowon@gmail.com
Subject Line: ‚ÄúApplication for Admin and Finance Officer‚Äù
Deadline: January 12, 2026

(Note: Applications without a cover letter and CV will not be considered. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for written tests and interviews. Telephone inquiries will not be entertained.)
